intro: Andira microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited andira, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, globose berries that turn from green to red when mature. Andira microcarpa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
